title: And Then There Were None audiobook by Agatha Christie EarReaders
description:
And Then There Were None (Ten Little Indians) â€“ 5hrs 53min â€“ Hugh Fraser
Considered the best mystery novel ever written by many readers, And Then There Were None is the story of 10 strangers, each lured to Indian Island by a Mr. U. N. Owen. Over dinner, a record begins to play, and the voice of an unseen host accuses each person of hiding a guilty secret. Unable to leave the island, the guests begin to share their darkest secrets--until they begin to die Who will be left to tell the tale?

One reviewer wrote, â€œThe whole thing is utterly impossible and utterly fascinating. It is the most baffling mystery Agatha Christie has ever written.' 

There is a newer recording by Dan Stevens but Hugh Fraserâ€™s narration is equally good
